Articles.Content:
This is the next and probably last version of my stock space shuttle.

General information:

-337 parts in four stages

-Comes at a cost of 227,474

-Boosted by 4 SRB's, providing 2600 kN

-Boosted by 1 LRB, providing 2500 kN

-Three SSME engines providing a total, vectored thrust of 645 kN

-Two OMS engines providing a total, vectored thrust of 100 kN

Instructions:

-Launch using SAS, RCS is not needed.

-Start a gravity turn at around 10 km.

-Make sure to lower the maximum thrust on the LRB to counter the shifting CoM

-Drop the SRB's

-Complete your orbit using the SSME's and the LRB.

-Upon circularisation, drop the booster tank.

-Activate OMS and use it to complete other burns

-Deorbit using the OMS

-Maintain an angle of attack of about 10 degrees, relative to the horizon

-When temperatures lower drop your nose to an angle of attack of about 20 degrees, relative to the horizon.

-When on your final approach pull up the nose and touch down. Average speed at touchdown is about 60 m/s.

Gallery:
Javascript is disabled. View full album

Download link: http://www./view/t6lz72la479v54d/STS-I_SAS.craft

Enjoy and leave some feedback!
Looks good, the shape seems accurate to the form of the Nasa space shuttle. Though no pics of the tank or booster separations, or orbital burns?
It doesn't have enough room for crew, or a large enough anything, but still good.
